intro: Euphrasia abscondita, commonly known as the hidden eyebright, is a rare and elusive flowering plant native to specific regions of Europe. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that bloom in the early spring. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist habitats such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers feature five petals with a distinctive yellow center. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, Euphrasia abscondita is considered a vulnerable species in many areas.
